Package managerpro.Utils

Class LanguageUtils

java.lang.Object
managerpro.Utils.LanguageUtils
public class LanguageUtils
extends java.lang.Object
Utility class, that hold methods and properties for formatting different elements of the UI based on Locale. It's used to bring higher degree of i18n to the software, and to enable easy addition of new languages. It also contains a rudimentary translator, that can be used to translate the Hibernate entities toString -outputs to different language. The translator needs some work to improve reliability over wider range of Locales. Majority of the methods and properties are available only in static context.
Author:
OTP7

    • resourceBundle

      private static java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle

    • getString

      public static java.lang.String getString​(java.lang.String key)
      A method to get string resources from the bundle. Will throw a NPE if key is null, MissingResourceException if no object for the given key can be found or a ClassCastException, if the object found for the given key is not a string
      Parameters:
      key - A string, that will be used as a key to get a resource from the resourceBundle
      Returns:
      A string value that was found with the key.

    • setLanguage

      public static void setLanguage​(java.lang.String language)
      Sets the currentLanguage member to parameter and checks if the language is in the languages -map. If not, the language is set to default. Then the resourceBundle is loaded for the language
      Parameters:
      language - A string parameter that is set to currentLanguage and is used as a key for languages -map

    • getLanguages

      public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getLanguages()

    • translateToString

      public static java.lang.String translateToString​(java.lang.Object o)
      A rudimentary translator function, that takes an object, uses the objects toString() method, splits the return value at whitespace and looks for values in the resourceBundle The algorithm finds phrases and translates them. The algorithm reads 'words' from the whitespace -split string array, until it encounters a word that has a 'phrase ending character'. After reading as many words before the phrase ending character, it builds a string from all of the words and tries to translate it. If no translation was found in resourceBundle, it drops the last word and tries a shorter phrase, until it finds a translation, or all the words have been dropped. The algorithm keeps track of it's progress, and iterates until the output of o.toString() has been handled.
      Parameters:
      o - Object whose toString() -method needs to be translated
      Returns:
      Returns the translated string.

    • getCurrentLanguageTag

      public static java.lang.String getCurrentLanguageTag()
      Return the language tag of the current language.
      Returns:
      A language tag string (eg en-US)
